file_content.text: You must be Gorima. Time to talk.
What? How did you get in here?
The hard way.
So you are not here with my underwriters. No, you are something else entirely. You are trouble.
Care to tell me where your "underwriters" are?
I want Arkous and Darok.
I am unable to comply with your request, as I do not know their present location. However, I do know where they intend to be.
Are you making cyborgs in here?
What are you up to?
My creations are far more than mere cyborgs.
"Trouble" is putting it mildly. I'm the thing that haunts you in your sleep.
I'm a nightmare.
I do not dream, but I understand the meaning behind what you say. I will not cross you.
Colonel Darok and Darth Arkous will arrive shortly to claim these prototype Rakata-tech warriors. They are self-repairing, virtually immortal.
I am most proud of my creations, though it did take many dozens of attempts to make the grafting process non-lethal.
Gorima! You planned to cut me open, you double-dealing gorryl slug!
It was not my decision! Admittedly, I was eager for my first attempt at an implant on a Wookiee....
He mustn't get another chance to betray us! Shoot him already!
Let your hate be your guide, Jakarro.
Yes, shoot him.
No one's stopping you, Jakarro. Have at him.
Go ahead.
That felt good.
Gorima could still be of use to us. Put your weapon down.
Don't. We may need him.
The ugly fish deserves to die!
I'm not going to repeat myself, Jakarro.
Stay down! I do not want to look at you.
How very unexpected....
This is the potential complication you sensed?
No--this is not my advisor, but rather an associate. It would appear Beniko laid out a convincing case that I'm up to no good.
No, my advisor is not among them, though I still sense her presence. It would appear Beniko convinced my associates here that I'm up to no good.
You're a traitor.
Your betrayal of the Empire will be your downfall, Arkous.
Come now, Wrath. We both know the state the Emperor is in. There's hardly an Empire to betray.
You spit upon everything the Dark Council represents.
The Dark Council.... A myopic institution that does nothing more than boost the egos of those who smother its gilded seats.
I've done some shady stuff in my time, but you deserting the Empire for the Republic? That's on a whole other level.
You might have had a leg to stand on with that one, Hunter--if you knew what you were talking about.
You seem to have forgotten where your loyalties are meant to lie.
She thinks you've gone to the other side, Arkous.
He thinks you've gone to the other side, Arkous.
It is somewhat amusing, isn't it?
Was she lying? Make your case for how you're not betraying the Empire with this Darok person.
Convince me otherwise.
Oh, I am most definitely acting against the Empire's narrow interests. But what I do is not for ill; it is for the future of this galaxy.
Sorry to cut this short, but since we have everything we need....
This is no way to greet an associate, Arkous. You should be nice and close so I can hold out my hand--and strangle you with it.
Come out and fight.
Such a passion for violence. I suppose that's what made you so useful on Tython and Korriban.
Thanks for giving us everything we need. Now we can get started in earnest.
Not everything. Gorima's dead.
Not everything. You don't have Gorima. We do.
Oh, we don't need Gorima himself. Not anymore. We only ever needed the results of his research.
We're leaving now. As this facility comes crashing down upon itself, enjoy a preview of our Infinite Army.
Are you Gorima?
I am, and I'm never going to finish with so many interruptions! Go back to Darok and tell him to stop pestering me!
You need to stop what you're doing and answer my questions.
Then you aren't one of Darok's people. An intruder. What do you want from me?
I want to know what Darok and Arkous are planning. What are you doing here?
Creating an army. Or at least, the first recruits.
Rakata technology is self-repairing. Quite marvelous to observe, though quite fatal when implanted into live hosts without my special treatment process.
Once the implants are accepted by the host tissues, they work in unison. Enhancing strength, repairing damage... the perfect soldiers.
There you are! Time to learn the cost for crossing Jakarro, eel!
Please, it was nothing personal! You have to understand--you're such an impressive specimen!
What are you waiting for? Do it! Before he has a chance to betray us again!
You don't have to be like him, Jakarro. You can be better.
Show mercy.
We play things your way. But if he even looks at me again....
He's all yours, Jakarro. We're done with him.
Go ahead and kill him.
That felt good.
Well, that explains the dead guards.
I knew I sensed someone familiar.
I told you to let it go. You did your part--none of this concerns you.
You're shoving antiques into people's guts to make an army. Yeah--I'm concerned.
Are you kidding me?
What is this all about, Darok? Why are you doing this?
I want answers.
If you think that shield is going to protect you from me, you're wrong.
You're dead. Both of you.
It doesn't have to hold for long.
I see you killed poor Gorima. It's too bad--he would've enjoyed seeing us put the first of our Infinite Army to work.
Gorima? Thank you for forwarding the research data along--our Infinite Army will serve us well. You can keep the prototypes.
We're working for the good of the entire galaxy--the Republic, the Empire, everyone. We can't let you interfere.
Feel free to die before the facility reaches crush depth. It will probably be more comfortable that way.
A Jedi isn't so easily distracted from the truth, Darok.
You should have known better.
You don't even know what you're interfering with.
You want to surrender without violence.
[Force Persuade] Surrender.
I... want to... ugh!
Foolish tricks won't change anything.
You betrayed the Republic, and you risked the lives of good soldiers to do it. I won't let you get away with that.
Don't give me that garbage.
Treason? A few dead pawns? That's all you care about? Our work is so much more important than that.
Well, you won't have to worry about any of that once you're dead.
To save the galaxy.
